speaker: human
content: I know that $\mu_s = \tan(\theta)$, so I need to find the angle of the incline. What is the angle?

speaker: human
content: so the coefficient of friction is 0.3463?

speaker: ai
content: Not necessarily. μs = tan(θ) only when θ is the critical angle where the block is just about to start slipping. Was 19.1° the onset-of-motion angle? If not, slowly increase the incline until the block just begins to slide, then read that angle.

speaker: human
content: is the block currently sliding at 19.1?

speaker: ai
content: No—the block is not sliding at 19.1°.

speaker: ai
content: No—at 22° it is still not sliding.

speaker: ai
content: Yes—at 25° the block begins to slide.

speaker: ai
content: Yes—at 23.5° the block just begins to slide.

speaker: human
content: so to be clear 23.5 is the critical angle?

speaker: human
content: so the coefficient of friction is about 0.4349
